thread.title: Kyle Schwarber HR ball is encased in glass atop scoreboard

title: Kyle Schwarber HR ball is encased in glass atop scoreboard
text:
Follow @dancahill_cst
The late Ernie “Mr. Cub” Banks waited years to get his statue outside Wrigley Field.
In less than a season, Kyle Schwarber has left his indelible mark on the historic landmark. Schwarber’s seventh-inning home run that landed on top of the video scoreboard in right field will remain there for now, according to the Cubs, encased in Plexiglas.
Call the new Wrigley Field display, “The Schwarball.”
The Cubs have put glass over Kyle Schwarber's home run ball on the video board (H/T @dannyecker ) pic.twitter.com/c6UOn3Po0O
— Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 14, 2015
Ironically for the Cubs, the only ones able to view it will be rooftop dwellers.
